title: Cowboys honor Kneeland in win: 'Still with us'
content: The Cowboys wanted to honor Marshawn Kneeland by how they played in their return to the field against the Raiders on Monday night, with coach Brian Schottenheimer saying, "We wanted to make him proud."

title: Va. Tech hires Franklin; PSU buyout renegotiated
content: Virginia Tech hired James Franklin to be its next football coach. The former Penn State coach was originally owed a $49 million buyout after being fired, but part of his deal with the Hokies includes a $9 million settlement from PSU, sources told ESPN.

title: Bengals' Chase suspended one game for spitting
content: Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase has been suspended one game without pay for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey.

title: Sources: Spurs' Wembanyama out for a few weeks
content: Victor Wembanyama, who had an MRI on Sunday, will be sidelined for a few weeks as the Spurs are being cautious about his left calf strain, sources told ESPN.

title: Man charged with murder in shooting of Beam
content: A 27-year-old man was charged Monday with murder in the death of celebrated former football coach John Beam.

title: Giannis set for MRI after exiting with groin strain
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo left in the second quarter of Monday's loss to the Cavaliers because of a left groin strain.

title: Skaggs' mom: Angels never asked about addiction
content: Debbie Hetman, the mother of Tyler Skaggs, said she didn't know whether her son informed the Angels of his drug addiction but added that she was never asked.

title: Source: Sanders' home broken into during debut
content: There was a break-in at the home of Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders during Sunday's game against the Ravens, a source confirmed to ESPN on Monday.

title: Fixing the Mavs: Why there's no cure-all for this Dallas disaster
content: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

title: The Chiefs aren't broken -- but they could miss the playoffs: Barnwell on what has gone wrong
content: The Chiefs are 5-5 after losing to the Broncos. They're third in the AFC West, and ESPN's FPI has them at 55.4% to make the playoffs. Is it time to worry?

title: Connelly's 25 favorite games: How they went down and what they mean
content: From A&M's historic comeback to heart-stoppers at all levels, Week 12 was packed with games to remember.

title: NFL offensive coordinators and playcallers: What has gone right and wrong for all 32 teams
content: NFL Nation reporters break down the good and bad for each OC/playcaller and peg the key to success the rest of the season.

title: Players react to efforts to halt team report cards: 'Pushback shows it's working'
content: NFL players who spoke to ESPN say the report cards are making a tangible impact on workplace conditions.

title: A weekend with the banana suits and shirtless fans surviving Oklahoma State
content: It has been a bad year for the Pokes. It hasn't stopped their fans from making their own bright spots.

title: Grading bold season predictions for all 30 MLB teams
content: It's time to see if what we said about each club going into the season was accurate or not -- and what it means for 2026.

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 11: MVP for Josh Allen? Sack record for Myles Garrett?
content: Is Allen a prime MVP candidate again? Has the AFC West torch been passed? We overreact to Week 11, plus fantasy football takes.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll Week 2 reaction: What to know about every team
content: The second in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what next for every team in the standings.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: The second in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Cena makes final 'Raw' appearance: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Cam Skattebo, Abdul Carter and Giants scuffle ringside with Judgement Day at 'Raw'
content: The New York Giants took matters into their own hands -- or fists -- when Judgement Day called them out.

title: Paul vs. Joshua: Everything you need to know
content: How did the fight come together? What does this fight mean for Paul, Joshua? Andreas Hale answers this questions and more.

title: The NHL's best this week: How the Devils move forward minus Jack Hughes
content: One of the game's elite players will be out eight weeks for a division leader. Plus, a look at the week's key games.

title: Buzz: Week 11 was a rough one for many superstars
content: Week 11 brought opportunities for top fantasy options, but it also saw many disappointing performances.

title: 2026 World Cup: Germany, Netherlands book their places
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it's looking around the globe.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot since 1998
content: With the likes of Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard, Norway are ready to make an impact on the big stage.

title: UFC 322 fight grades: Shevchenko, Makhachev were good but boring
content: Back-to-back-to-back knockouts gave the UFC 322 main card life, but the title bouts cooled things off.

title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets to consider going into Week 12.

title: Draymond Green reflects on being on receiving end of Wemby alley-oop slam
content: Though the play didn't count, Victor Wembanyama's dunk over Draymond Green on Friday quickly became a viral moment.

title: Why a 1990s Isuzu Trooper was a meaningful 30th birthday gift for Karl-Anthony Towns
content: The New York Knicks star's girlfriend went out of her way to revive a priceless memory for his 30th birthday.

title: How five-star Austin Goosby fits at Texas, more 2026 commitment projections
content: Breaking down top class of 2026 commitments, including the five-star who stayed in-state to play for Texas.

title: Man United's plan: Save millions in wages, rebuild midfield
content: Next summer looms as a busy transfer period for Manchester United: More than £1 million in wages will be offloaded, which will in turn free up space for some major midfield upgrades.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City, Liverpool, Spurs eye Semenyo release clause
content: Manchester City, Liverpool and Tottenham all hold an interest in signing Bournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Amit Shah's Maoist-Free India Deadline Nears Reality With Madvi Hidma's Death
content: The killing of Madvi Hidma, a Central Committee member and formidable head of People's Liberation Guerrilla Army (PLGA) Battalion No. 1, is a severe operational and ideological blow to the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist).

title: Married Man Tries To Forcibly Kiss Ex-Girlfriend, She Bites Off His Tongue
content: On Monday afternoon, the woman had gone to the pond to collect clay for the stove. Seeing his love alone, Champi decided to follow her to the pond, where he grabbed her and molested her.

title: Existing Voters Will Not Face Problems: Assam Poll Body On Special Revision
content: As the Election Commission rolled out 'Special Revision' of electoral rolls of Assam from Tuesday, the state's Chief Electoral Officer Anurag Goel stressed that existing voters will not face any problem under the exercise.

title: "Impossible, False": Election Body On RJD's 25,000 Pre-Loaded Votes Claim
content: The Election Commission on Tuesday dismissed senior RJD leader Jagdanand Singh's allegation that each EVM used in the Bihar polls had 25,000 votes even before polling, saying it is "technically impossible" and "procedurally false".

title: Kannada Film Actor Alleges Stalking, Harassment By Businessman She Met In 2022
content: According to the complaint submitted to the police on October 17, the actress had met the businessman, identified as Aravind Venkatesh Reddy, during an event in Sri Lanka.

title: Sheikh Hasina Sentenced To Death By Court She Created To Try War Criminals
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death by the court she established in 2010 to try war crimes from the 1971 liberation war.

title: Inside Track On Lalu Family Feud: Tejashwi Refused Opposition Leader Role
content: Taking responsibility for the Rashtriya Janata Dal's (RJD) debacle in the Bihar polls, Tejashwi Yadav had refused to become the Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly, but agreed to take up the role after his father Lalu Prasad Yadav

title: Kerala Mother, Stepfather Charged Under UAPA For 'Luring' Son To Join ISIS
content: A 16-year-old boy from Thiruvananthapuram was allegedly persuaded to join the Islamic State by his mother and stepfather, prompting police to register a UAPA case.

title: Red Fort Blast Suicide Bomber's 'Co-Conspirator' Sent To 10-Day NIA Custody
content: A Delhi court on Tuesday sent to 10 days' NIA custody Jasir Bilal, an "active co-conspirator" of suicide bomber Umar un Nabi, in connection with the Red Fort car blast that claimed 15 lives.

title: Can India Deny Dhaka's Request To Extradite Sheikh Hasina? What Rules Say
content: After Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh's ousted prime minister, was sentenced to death in absentia for "crimes against humanity", the interim government in Dhaka urged India to immediately extradite the deposed leader.

title: Fraud, Kidnappings: Why Iran Suspended Visa-Free Travel For Indians
content: Indians won't be allowed to enter Iran visa-free from November 22, after Tehran suspended the facility following an increase in fraud and trafficking cases.

title: Tej Pratap Seeks Probe If Parents Were Subjected To 'Mental Harassment'
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, who lost the election from the Mahua assembly seat, voiced his sentiments in support of his sister Rohini Acharya.

title: 'We Risk Losing Old World That Kept Us Human': Supreme Court Judge Warns Of 'Civilisational Tremor'
content: Citing cases of elderly citizens deceived by digital frauds, abandoned by family members or trapped in lifelong litigation, Justice Surya Kant said the law must serve as a "renewing framework of dignity".

title: "Promise To Hold Your Hand While You Soar": Gautam Adani On Adani Airports
content: Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group, on Tuesday unveiled a new heartwarming airport film, promising to offer human touch while also providing world-class service at Adani Airports.

title: Meet John Ternus, Apple Executive Who Might Replace CEO Tim Cook
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook may leave his post as early as next year, with the company's board and senior executives accelerating succession plans, the Financial Times reported.

title: 24 Years Before Delhi Blast, A Shoe Bomber Almost Blew Up An American Flight
content: In 2001, al-QThe probe into the November 10 Delhi blast hinted that a shoe bomb was used inside the car, which exploded near the Red Fort. aeda terrorist Richard Reid attempted to blow up an American Airlines flight using TATP-packed footwear.

title: Project Prometheus: How Jeff Bezos Plans To Use AI Beyond Chatbots
content: Unlike traditional chatbots, Project Prometheus aims to build AI that can interact with the physical world.

title: Opinion: Opinion | With Sheikh Hasina's Death Sentence, It's 1975 Again In Bangladesh
content: Hasina becomes an emblem of the circularity of South Asian history, where leaders are alternately elevated as saviours and condemned as tyrants, often within a single lifetime.

title: Chandigarh's Musical Crackdown: 'Dhol Fine Drive' Issues 1st Littering Fine
content: The Chandigarh Municipal Corporation has rolled out a unique campaign, "Dhol Fine Drive," to curb littering in the city. Under the initiative, special teams patrol streets, markets, and public areas, issuing fines and playing traditional drums (dhol)

title: Delhi blast: Cong MP's 'misguided' remark sparks fury; BJP calls him 'spin doctor'
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticized Congress MP Imran Masood for calling suicide bomber Umar Un Nabi a "misguided youth." Poonawalla accused the Congress of prioritizing vote bank politics over national interest, citing past instances where opposition leaders allegedly downplayed terror acts. The remarks came after a video emerged of the bomber justifying his actions.

title: Chop, change and crumble: How Gambhir’s Test tactics are hurting India at home
content: While he has been spot-on in limited-overs formats, the head coach's red-ball stint has been marked by a stubborn preference for underprepared tracks, which have put India's batters at a disadvantage. The constant chopping & changing also seems to have led to declining results.

title: 'Shouted at stupid people': Trump says trade talks with 'a country' left his voice hoarse
content: President Trump explained his hoarse voice stemmed from arguing with individuals he deemed "stupid" about trade and tariff policies. He admitted to "blowing his stack" during discussions with an unnamed country attempting to renegotiate a trade deal, a move that has become a central point of his economic agenda amidst a Supreme Court review of his emergency powers.

title: Babar Azam slapped with heavy fine; ICC punish batter for code of conduct breach
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam faced a penalty from the ICC, receiving a 10% match fee fine for a Code of Conduct breach.  The incident involved him striking the stumps with his bat after being dismissed in the third ODI against Sri Lanka. This marks his first offense in two years, resulting in a demerit point.

title: Delhi 2020 riots 'attack on sovereignty': Cops oppose Umar Khalid's bail in SC
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2020 Delhi riots were a pre-planned attempt to divide society communally, not a spontaneous protest. He argued accused activists are responsible for trial delays. Meanwhile, the Delhi high court directed police to update on riot investigations, noting petitions have been pending for six years without pursuing alternate legal remedies.

title: Google's rare milestone: First-ever ‘appreciation note’ in 25 yrs; from world’s biggest investor
content: Berkshire Hathaway has made its first-ever $4.3 billion investment in Google-parent Alphabet, a move analysts attribute to a leadership transition and Alphabet's strong financial profile. This significant purchase, alongside a reduction in its Apple stake, signals a potential broadening of Berkshire's tech investment strategy under new leadership.

title: 'You'll hear good news ...': Goyal on India-US trade deal; what's in focus
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal indicated that a trade pact between India and the US is nearing completion, emphasizing the need for a fair, equitable, and balanced agreement. He assured that India will continue to protect the interests of its farmers, fishermen, and small industries during ongoing negotiations.

title: 'I will retire if ... ': Prashant Kishor changes stance on vow to quit politics
content: Jan Suraaj supremo Prashant Kishor accepted full responsibility for his party's complete failure in the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, admitting he could not earn voters' trust. Despite contesting 238 seats, Jan Suraaj won none, with Kishor vowing to intensify his work in Bihar and observe a silent fast as atonement.

title: 'Even Sachin, Virat won't survive here': Harbhajan tears into Eden pitch
content: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh came down heavily on the pitch curator during his YouTube show, expressing concerns over the direction in which Test cricket is heading in the country. India suffered a 30-run defeat in the first Test against South Africa at the Eden Garden in Kolkata, exposing their struggles against quality spin.  Chasing a modest target of 124, the Indian batting lineup folded for just 93 runs.

title: Apple designer Abidur Chowdhury quits: Why man behind Apple’s thinnest iPhone left
content: Apple's iPhone Air designer, Abidur Chowdhury, has exited the tech giant for an AI startup, adding to a wave of departures from the company's design division.  His exit, despite his prominent role, is reportedly unrelated to the iPhone Air's sales performance, which has been below expectations.  This move occurs as Apple's design leadership undergoes significant restructuring, with teams now reporting directly to CEO Tim Cook, signaling a new era for the company's famed aesthetic.

title: Saudi bus accident: 3 generations wiped out as 18 from one family killed
content: A family's joy turned to tragedy when 18 members of the Shaik family perished in a bus fire in Saudi Arabia while en route to Medina. The family, who lived in a bustling home in Hyderabad's Vidyanagar, were on a pilgrimage. Only one immediate family member, living in the US, survives this devastating loss.

title: H-1B visa holders are not ‘cheap labour’ - why foreign workers are important for US
content: A National Foundation for American Policy report argues that H-1B visa restrictions, including a new $100,000 fee, are counterproductive. The report highlights that H-1B holders are highly skilled professionals earning substantial salaries, not cheap labor, and that limiting these visas could drive jobs and innovation abroad.

title: SC: Tetra packs of whisky dangerous, why allow them?
content: The Supreme Court expressed concern over states permitting liquor sales in small tetra packs, likening them to juice containers and highlighting potential risks to children. This issue emerged during a trademark dispute between whisky producers Allied Blenders and John Distillers, where tetra packs constitute a significant portion of sales in some regions.

title: NASA to share photos of the comet going viral as alien
content: NASA will unveil new images of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar visitor sparking alien probe theories. Its unusual nickel release and trajectory have intrigued scientists like Avi Loeb. While harmless to Earth, the comet's journey offers a unique chance to study an object from beyond our galaxy. Tune in tomorrow for the live event.

title: PhysicsWallah IPO: Shares list with strong gains; should buy, sell or hold?
content: PhysicsWallah debuted strongly on the stock market, with shares rising significantly above its IPO price. This surge reflects investor confidence in the edtech firm's brand and hybrid model, though analysts suggest caution due to competition and profitability concerns. The IPO, one of the largest in India's edtech sector, was driven by institutional investors.

title: 'I'll do it again': Pakistani rapper drapes himself in Indian flag- watch video
content: Pakistani rapper Talha Anjum caused a stir by waving the Indian flag during a concert in Nepal.  He later defended his actions, stating his art has no borders and he does not care about propaganda.  While some Pakistanis criticised the move, many Indians praised the gesture. The incident has generated significant social media discussion.

title: FMCG sector: Sales growth slows in September quarter as GST changes hit volumes
content: India's FMCG sector saw sales growth slow in Q3, with volume up 5.4% due to GST changes. Rural markets led expansion at 7.7%, outpacing urban areas. E-commerce remains a key driver, especially in metros, while modern trade shows revival. Inflation cooling is expected to boost consumption.

title: 'I take 100% responsibility': Prashant breaks silence on defeat; announces 'maun upvas'
content: Jan Suraaj supremo Prashant Kishor has taken full responsibility for his party's zero-seat performance in the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections. Admitting his efforts were unsuccessful, Kishor announced a day-long silent fast as atonement for failing to win people's faith and vowed to work harder to fulfill his resolve to improve Bihar.

title: Girlalala cause of death: How did the TikTok star die at just 21
content: Rising social media star Girlalala, 21, was fatally shot in Lauderdale Lakes, Florida, on November 14, 2025. Police arrested her boyfriend, Shanoyd Whyte Jr., 25, charging him with first-degree murder. The shooting reportedly followed a physical argument inside a car. Her tragic death has shocked fans and ignited discussions on influencer safety and domestic violence.

title: Ambulance carrying family catches fire near Modasa town; 4, including infant, killed, 3 injured
content: Tragedy struck near Modasa as an ambulance carrying a family and an infant to Ahmedabad caught fire, claiming four lives, including the baby. The vehicle, dispatched by a private hospital, erupted in flames around midnight. A doctor and nurse were also among the deceased. Three individuals sustained burn injuries and are receiving medical attention.

title: MLB rumors: Dodgers unlikely to chase $102M Mets pitcher amid Tanner Scott setback
content: The Los Angeles Dodgers are reportedly stepping back from a massive $102 million bidding war for a top free-agent reliever. Following a costly acquisition last year, the team is now eyeing more affordable options like Pete Fairbanks to bolster their bullpen, aiming for a balanced approach to strengthen their roster for 2026.

title: Ind vs SA: Who did what in first training session post India's 1st Test loss?
content: Indian batters Sai Sudharsan and Dhruv Jurel experimented with batting without a front pad during optional practice, a technique aimed at improving front-foot play against spin. This traditional drill encourages batters to rely on their bat for defense, addressing a tendency to play on the back foot. The move comes as Shubman Gill's participation in the upcoming Test remains uncertain.

title: IPO Mania: India’s favourite lottery - Everyone wants the jackpot; few realise the house always wins
content: India's IPO market has seen a surge in applications, driven by the allure of listing gains rather than long-term investment. Despite the frenzy, over half of IPOs offer minimal gains, with successful allotments resembling a lottery. This pursuit of quick profits has become a national obsession, rewarding randomness over reasoned analysis.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal extends losses; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver prices saw a significant drop for the third consecutive day, influenced by waning expectations of a December US Federal Reserve rate cut. This decline, despite historically high levels, has impacted investor sentiment.  Traders are now closely watching upcoming US economic data and Fed meeting minutes for future market direction.

title: 'He'll break my head or my toe': KL Rahul makes shocking Bumrah admission
content: KL Rahul humorously expressed concern about facing Jasprit Bumrah in nets after learning of his strong IPL record against the pacer. Rahul highlighted Bumrah's intensity and difficulty to score against, even for familiar teammates. He revealed his strategy of reminding Bumrah they are on the same team to calm him during practice.

title: 'Filthy dorms and chaos': Indian archers stranded in Dhaka after flight fiasco
content: After their triumphant performance at the Asian Championship, India's archery team found themselves in dire straits in Dhaka. A sudden flight cancellation, fueled by escalating unrest in the city, left them stranded in an inadequate shelter for the night, void of security. The turmoil resulted in missed flights and unexpected expenses, casting a shadow over their exceptional victory.

title: ‘Varanasi’: Priyanka Chopra tops Deepika Padukone and Alia Bhatt as India’s highest-paid actress
content: Priyanka Chopra is making a grand comeback to Indian cinema with SS Rajamouli’s ‘Varanasi’, co-starring Mahesh Babu and Prithviraj Sukumaran. Reportedly charging Rs 30 crore for her role as Mandakini, she becomes India’s highest-paid actress. Following the success of ‘RRR’, Rajamouli’s ambitious collaboration promises a major cinematic spectacle.

title: 'Misunderstood concept of suicide bombing': Delhi bomber’s chilling video surfaces
content: A chilling video from Red Fort blast accused Umar Un Nabi surfaces, where he attempts to justify suicide bombings as a 'martyrdom operation' in Islam. He describes it as a deliberate act where death is certain, yet paradoxically states such actions are unacceptable in any civilized society. Investigators believe the video was meant to radicalize others.

title: Gujarat horror: Man strangles wife for ‘jobless’ jibe; arrested
content: A man in Vadodara allegedly strangled his wife late Sunday night. The couple frequently argued about his unemployment. During a heated argument, the wife reportedly taunted him about his joblessness. The man then lost his temper and attacked her. Police have registered a murder complaint and arrested the accused.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’: Ranveer Singh on working with 20-year younger Sara Arjun
content: The trailer for Ranveer Singh's film Dhurandhar is out. Ranveer Singh praised his young co-star Sara Arjun. He called her a prodigy and one of the finest actors he has worked with. He believes she was born to act. Dhurandhar also stars Madhavan and Sanjay Dutt. The film releases on December 5, 2025.

title: Karnataka wildlife crisis: 31 of 38 blackbucks dead in Belagavi zoo
content: Karnataka's zoos are enhancing vigilance after 31 blackbucks died, suspected to be from haemorrhagic septicaemia.  Authorities have directed zoos to strengthen biosecurity, isolate affected animals, and implement immediate carcass disposal and quarantine measures to prevent further outbreaks.

title: Cash vouchers for newlyweds: This Chinese city has come out with ways to woo couples
content: In a unique initiative to boost declining marriage rates, Ningbo, China, is offering 1,000 yuan in consumption vouchers to newlywed couples. This move aims to encourage young people to marry and start families amidst rising costs. Other cities are also implementing similar voucher schemes. Chinese authorities are prioritizing increased marriage and birth rates to counter an aging population.

title: Indian student sentenced to 97 months in prison in Texas; here is why
content: An Indian student, Dhruv Rajeshbhai Mangukiya, received a 97-month prison sentence and ordered to pay over $2.5 million in restitution for a money laundering conspiracy. He and his co-conspirator targeted elderly individuals, tricking them into sending cash and gold to resolve fabricated investigations. Mangukiya also admitted to recruiting his co-conspirator and using a printer for fake IDs.

title: Woman drugged, gang-raped by 4; then raped again by 2 UP cops
content: Two sub-inspectors in Bulandshahr face suspension following a survivor's grave allegations of rape and extortion. The 28-year-old woman claims the officers sexually assaulted her for two days and demanded Rs 50,000, purportedly for action against her initial gang-rape assaulters. An inquiry is underway into the serious accusations.

title: Bomb threat in Delhi: 2 CRPF schools, 3 courts get Jaish-e-Mohammad mail
content: Two CRPF schools and three court complexes in Delhi received bomb threats via e-mail on Tuesday, triggering immediate security alerts. Authorities evacuated students, staff, and court personnel as a precautionary measure while bomb disposal teams conducted thorough checks. The Delhi Police are investigating the source of these threats.

title: Top Maoist leader Hidma among 6 gunned down in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri
content: Six Maoists were killed in a fierce exchange of fire in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri district on Tuesday morning. This follows another Maoist death in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district. Security forces are continuing searches in the cordoned-off areas.

title: 'I will sort it out': Lalu Yadav tells RJD MLAs fallout with Rohini ‘family issue’
content: RJD chief Lalu Prasad urged party workers to focus on strengthening the organization, stating that the "family matter will be solved inside the house." This comes after his daughter Rohini Acharya publicly blamed Tejashwi Yadav's aides for the party's election defeat and alleged mistreatment.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’ trailer out: Ranveer, Madhavan and Akshaye Khanna stun in new looks
content: The highly anticipated trailer for 'Dhurandhar' has dropped, showcasing Ranveer Singh in a rugged spy role. The film, featuring a star-studded cast including R Madhavan and Sanjay Dutt, has generated significant buzz.  With catchy Punjabi music and a reported runtime of 185 minutes, it's poised to be a blockbuster and potentially Ranveer's longest film.

title: Delhi Red Fort blast: 2 more victims succumb to injuries; death toll goes up to 15
content: The Red Fort blast toll has climbed to 15 with two more victims succumbing to their injuries. Vinay Pathak, who was buying items in Chandni Chowk, and Mohammad Luqman, a trinket seller, are the latest to die. Families recount harrowing experiences of discovering their loved ones' fates after the explosion.

title: ​​What makes baby teeth come in early or late? Study points to mom’s hormones
content: New research indicates that a mother's hormone levels during pregnancy, particularly stress-related ones like cortisol, may influence the timing of a baby's first tooth eruption. Higher maternal levels of cortisol, estradiol, progesterone, testosterone, and T3 were associated with more teeth erupting by certain ages, highlighting the prenatal hormonal environment's role in early dental development.

title: '14 ke ho, kaise maarte ho ye chakke?': Oman players puzzled by Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: India's 14-year-old batting prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi has captivated young Oman cricketers Samay Shrivastava and Aryan Bisht with his explosive six-hitting prowess.  Suryavanshi's record-breaking 144 against UAE and 45 against Pakistan Shaheens have left the duo eager to meet him.  Both Shrivastava and Bisht share fascinating journeys from India to representing Oman.

title: Aviation industry: ICRA keeps outlook ‘stable’ as domestic traffic set for modest rise
content: India's aviation sector anticipates modest domestic passenger growth of 4-6% in 2025-26, despite earlier disruptions like cross-border tensions and an air tragedy. International traffic is set for a stronger 13-15% surge.

title: Urban unemployment rate in October at 3-month high of 7%, shows PLFS
content: Overall unemployment held steady at 5.2% in October, though urban joblessness rose to a three-month high of 7%. The Labour Force Participation Rate reached a six-month high of 55.4%, driven by a significant increase in female participation, particularly in rural areas. This surge in the female workforce contributed to a rising overall worker population ratio.

title: Watch: Plane carrying Congo minister, 20 others bursts into flames
content: A chartered Embraer jet carrying Congo's mines minister and 20 others skidded off the runway and caught fire at Kolwezi Airport. The aircraft, returning from Kinshasa, overshot the runway, with its tail erupting in flames. Miraculously, all passengers evacuated safely with no reported injuries or fatalities. Investigations into the incident are underway.

title: Who is ‘Bubba’? The mystery name in Epstein’s emails fanning Trump–Clinton rumours
content: A 2018 email between Jeffrey and Mark Epstein mentioning "Bubba" sparked speculation that it referred to Bill Clinton. Mark Epstein later clarified that "Bubba" was a private individual and the email was light-hearted banter, not a serious allegation.

title: Navy sailor arrested in Kerala’s Kochi for alleged sexual assault on minor girl
content: Responding to the incident, the Southern Naval Command says it is looking into the matter with ‘utmost seriousness'

title: Bengaluru police urge people to use KSP app for safety
content: The app enables quick access to police assistance, particularly for individuals travelling through isolated or vulnerable areas

title: Parasocial is Cambridge dictionary’s Word of the Year 2025; delulu, slop among new entrants
content: Six thousand new words were also added to the dictionary in 2025, including 'delulu', 'slop', 'skibidi' and 'tradwife'

title: Man accused in 12 criminal cases arrested for vandalising police station in Kerala; two officers injured in scuffle
content: Police say the accused, who was brought to the station in Kasaragod in connection with a warrant case, smashed window glass by hitting his head against it before turning on two officers who intervened

title: Shiv Sena says 'disenchanted' Kerala worker who allegedly killed self was ‘always BJP member’
content: Anand K. Thampi decided to cooperate with Shiv Sena (UBT) because BJP denied him a seat, but this association lasted only for one day, says Sena’s State secretary Peringamala Aji

title: In Delhi study, ragas in the operation theatre cut anaesthesia use
content: Even under anaesthesia, the brain doesn’t shut down. The auditory cortex still registers sound. As surgery begins, the body’s stress systems stir and the levels of cortisol and other hormones rise, pushing up blood pressure to cope with the strain. The person feels nothing but the body still braces. Music seems to mellow this response

title: When global innovation finds a home in Bengaluru and Karnataka, it scales for the world: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: A defining feature of Karnataka’s approach is inclusivity and the State is consciously decentralising technology economy by developing Tier-2 cities as the next generation innovation clusters, said the CM

title: Lakhs queue up for Sabarimala pilgrimage; devotees complain of lack of water
content: Following complaints and large crowd of devotees, newly appointed TDB president K. Jayakumar says 200 additional personnel have been assigned to reach out to people in the queues and provide them with water

title: ECI must immediately demonstrate it's not operating under BJP’s shadow: Congress
content: BJP is attempting to weaponise the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls process for "vote chori", says Congress President

title: Chhattisgarh Maoists trying move into Andhra to revive Naxal movement, says official
content: Two days back, we received specific intelligence inputs that a few top Maoists, including Madvi Hidma, are planning to enter Andhra Pradesh to revive their movement, Intelligence chief of A.P. said

title: Indian mission in Jeddah sets up camp office in Medina after bus tragedy; Consul General meets lone survivor
content: Forty-four Indian Umrah pilgrims, including 42 from Telangana, were killed in a collision involving their bus and a fuel tanker near Medina in the wee hours of November 17, 2025

title: Ahead of PM Modi’s Coimbatore visit, T.N. CM Stalin puts forth three demands on behalf of farmers
content: Referring to the recent visit of central teams, he said orders have not yet been issued by the Government of India for relaxing the moisture content from 17% to 22%.

title: Red Fort blast: Delhi court remands suicide bomber’s ‘co-conspirator’ to 10-day NIA custody
content: Mediapersons were barred from entering the court premises, which virtually turned the proceedings 'in camera'

title: 28 CPI (Maoist) cadre, militia members arrested in Krishna district
content: The Naxalites, natives of Chhattisgarh, took shelter in a private house on Vijayawada outskirts pretending to be daily wage labourers, the police said

title: KIDROP — PPP with Karnataka government to prevent infant blindness — is expanding nationwide
content: World Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP) Day is observed on November 17 annually to raise awareness on preventable blindness among premature infants

title: Don’t view every Kashmiri Muslim with suspicion, says Omar Abdullah
content: The J&K Chief Minister stated that those behind the Delhi blast should be given the strictest punishment, but emphasised that the entire population of Jammu and Kashmir cannot be branded as sympathisers of terrorism

title: Maoist movement suffers a serious setback with encounter of Madvi Hidma
content: The encounter reportedly took place between 6 a.m. and 7 a.m., and combing operations are still ongoing, said Andhra Pradesh DGP Harish Kumar Gupta

title: In undated video, Red Fort suicide bomber Umar un Nabi seen rehearsing lines on the act
content: In the video shot by the doctor on his phone, he appears to be rehearsing his statement and turns away the phone when he loses the line of thought

title: Complaint of putting gamers at disadvantage leads to ED raid on 2 gaming companies in Bengaluru, Delhi and Gurugram
content: Some persons have filed FIRs accusing the gaming companies of manipulating the algorithm of the app, putting gamers at a disadvantage

title: Jharkhand farmers to get a bonus of ₹100 per quintal over Centre's MSP for paddy: Minister
content: "The Jharkhand government has prepared a proposal to pay an additional bonus of ₹100 on the MSP fixed by the Central government, which will be approved in the cabinet meeting very soon," says State Food and Public Distribution Minister

title: 14 illegal PG accommodations sealed in Bengaluru, East City Corporation launches trade licence drive
content: 466 business owners paid a combined fee of ₹25.52 lakh under the Single Window System and received their trade licence on the same day, without any involvement of intermediaries, according to the East City Corporation Commissioner

title: Delhi riots case hearing: No material change in circumstance to relook at Umar Khalid's bail rejection, Delhi Police tells SC
content: Delhi Police argues that the riots were not spontaneous but a orchestrated, pre-planned, and a well-designed one.

title: JD(U) would have been bundled up with 25 seats had it not given ₹10,000 to women, says Prashant Kishor
content: Prashant Kishor said that his Jan Suraaj Party made an honest effort but failed to make a mark in the polls and that he took full responsibility for the debacle

title: Urge Centre, Bihar Govt to order probe if my parents subjected to mental harassment: Tej Pratap
content: The former Bihar minister, who lost the election from Mahua assembly seat, voiced his sentiments in support of his sister Rohini Acharya

title: In a majority judgment, Supreme Court recalls own verdict striking down retrospective environmental clearances
content: One of the reasons to recall the judgment is the massive exercise of demolishing constructions that have been built on the strength of ex post facto environmental clearances over the years, says CJI B.R. Gavai

title: Newborn, doctor among 4 killed as ambulance catches fire in Gujarat
content: In the CCTV footage released by police, the ambulance can be seen slowing down near a petrol pump after the driver realised about fire on its rear side.

title: Top Maoist leader Madvi Hidma, wife among 6 killed in encounter at Papikonda National Park in Andhra Pradesh
content: Security forces recovered two AK-47s, 15 electrical detonators and 150 non-electrical detonators, and a few weapons and ammunition from the site during the operation

title: Rail fracture hits local train services on Central Railway's main line in Mumbai
content: The fracture was spotted on the down slow line at 7:32 a.m., prompting authorities to impose a speed restriction and divert services to maintain safety, says Railway officials

title: Belagavi MP Jagadish Shettar tells officials to speed up railway projects in the district
content: Officials told him that over 90% of the land acquisition for the Belagavi–Kittur–Dharwad new railway was complete and the work would start once the government of Karnataka transferred land to the railway department

title: ICG seizes three Bangladeshi boats, 79 fishermen for illegal fishing in Bay of Bengal
content: The interceptions took place during International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) surveillance operations on November 15 and 16

title: Kerala approaches Supreme Court to postpone Special Intensive Revision
content: The State said the 'cumbersome' SIR will coincide with the local bodies election and there are no human resources to conduct SIR and local bodies poll simultaneously

title: IT raids on three major Hyderabad biryani chains over tax evasion suspicion
content: Searches began early in the morning, with nearly 30 teams deployed across multiple premises of Pista House, Shah Ghouse and Mehfil Group of Restaurants

title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw ranked 2nd most generous woman by Hurun India, contributed ₹83 crore for philanthropic causes across R&D
content: For her, philanthropy has never been about the magnitude of giving, but was about giving with a purpose

title: Talent shortage on the rise in India despite producing an increasing number of graduates: Dr. Shamika Ravi, member of Prime Minister’s Economic Advisory Council
content: ’Universities are built for decades and centuries. I would urge all of you to think of not just the next 10 years, but the next 100’. says Wipro Chairperson Azim Premji

title: Maoist killed in encounter with police in Chhattisgarh’s Sukma
content: The exchange of fire started on a forested hill under Errabor police station limits when a team of security personnel was out on an anti-Maoist operation

title: Kerala local body polls: Fierce three-cornered battle on the cards in Varkala
content: In the 2025 local body elections, the BJP will be pushing for supremacy and the LDF careful not to lose its weakened grip on the municipality. On its part, the UDF will seek to recover lost ground, but it continues to be troubled by internal issues

title: Kerala local body polls: Congress attempts to brush aside the Bihar election blues
content: Though the poll outcome of Bihar may not have any direct bearing on the Congress and its allies in the State, the electoral debacle has left a dampening effect on the enthusiasm of the party workers.

title: Delhi car blast case: ED conducts searches at Faridabad’s Al-Falah University, linked persons
content: The chairman, Javed Ahmad, has been issued two summons to appear before the Delhi Police, a source told The Hindu

title: Protests over Shivaji bust removal from Pune govt office; reinstated amid uproar
content: The protesting outfits opposed the removal of the bust, claiming it had been part of a heritage structure

title: Odisha’s popular singer Humane Sagar dies at 36; CM Majhi, BJD’s Naveen Patnaik convey condolences
content: The Odia singer was diagnosed with bilateral pneumonia, acute on chronic liver failure (ACLF), multi-organ dysfunction syndrome and other complications

title: The trajectory of anti-rape laws in India | Explained
content: By condemning the 1979 Supreme Court acquittal in a custodial rape case, Chief Justice of India B. R. Gavai has highlighted India’s evolving legal reforms aimed at better protecting sexual assault survivors and redefining consent

title: Tamil Nadu rains: Cuddalore, Villupuram districts declare holiday for schools
content: Holiday declared for schools and colleges in Puducherry, Karaikal; ‘yellow’ alert for eight T.N. districts

title: Iran suspends visa waiver for Indians after ‘misuse by criminal elements’; MEA issues advisory
content: Visa-free entry ends from November 22, 2025; MEA urges Indian nationals to remain vigilant and avoid agents offering visa-free travel or onward transit to third countries via Iran

title: ITR forms, rules under new Income Tax Act to be notified by January: CBDT chief
content: The intent is to keep the income tax return (ITR) forms simple for taxpayers to ease compliance, he said

title: Chennai’s Museum of Possibilities shows what inclusive living can look like
content: Located on the State Commissionerate for Differently Abled campus on Marina Beach Road, MoP is a demonstration centre for assistive technology for people with disabilities

title: IIT Madras-Indian Railways jointly launch Omics Translational Research Lab
content: A press release stated that the lab would facilitate research on early diagnosis, disease prognosis, biomarker discovery, and drug screening across a spectrum of diseases

title: Centre’s move to exempt waste-to-energy plants from Environment Impact Assessment opposed
content: In its notification, the MoEFCC said solid-waste management systems play an important role in protecting environmental and human health, advancing the circular economy, and reducing air, land and water pollution.

title: Need for being vigilant against online fraud, cybercrimes stressed
content: Deputy Commissioner Divya Prabhu says it is required especially in the wake of increasing instances of online and financial fraud

title: Show cause notices issued to 196 medical shops after Statewide inspection drive uncovers violations
content: The inspections were carried out to identify irregularities in retail pharmacy practices, particularly concerning the sale of Schedule H1 medicines such as higher-generation antibiotics and habit-forming drugs

title: V. Srinivas takes charge as Rajasthan Chief Secretary
content: Along with the Chief Secretary’s post, Mr. Srinivas will hold the additional charge of chairman of the Rajasthan State Mines and Minerals Limited and the State’s Principal Resident Commissioner in New Delhi

title: India to submit updated climate targets to U.N. by December end: Bhupender Yadav
content: As a signatory to the Paris Agreement, it is a requirement that India issue an updated NDC in 2025, which spells out its voluntary actions towards transitioning away from using fossil fuel and improving energy efficiency use

title: MGL expects restoration of gas supply by November 18
content: The damage to the main gas supply pipeline of GAIL occurred at the RCF premises, Trombay, and also affected the gas supply at MGL’s City Gate Station (CGS) at Wadala since Sunday (November 16, 2025), MGL said

title: West Bengal school recruitment scam: ‘Tainted’ candidates have made it to the fresh interview list, allege teachers
content: Fresh protests erupted in Kolkata ahead of the interview as many ‘untainted’ teachers who lost their jobs after the Supreme Court order cry foul

title: School children move Delhi HC seeking rescheduling of outdoor sports to months with safer air quality
content: The petition states that the children, who actively participate in zonal, inter-zonal, state and national sporting activities, are being forced to engage in strenuous physical exertion in “a highly toxic environment”

title: Delhi CM targets Punjab over stubble burning; air quality continues to be ‘very poor’
content: The Delhi CMO said that Ms. Gupta said that states like Haryana, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh have shown positive progress in crop-residue management in recent years, but the volume of smoke coming from Punjab remains significantly high

title: In 2024-25, India remained leading place of origin of international students in U.S.: Report
content: The U.S. State Department sponsored report showed that total international students in U.S. went up by 5% in 2024-24, and new enrolments went down by about 7%

title: Madhya Pradesh government revokes land pooling scheme for permanent Kumbh city in Ujjain amid farmers’ protest
content: The decision to repeal the scheme comes amid protests from various farmer organisations and before a major agitation in Ujjain on Tuesday (November 18, 2025); the Bharatiya Kisan Sangh has called back the agitation

title: More women enrol in defence and strategic studies course in University of Madras over the past few years
content: The course offers an array of topics that shapes the students’ strategic thought on national security and offers subjects including specialised warfare, conflict resolution, arms control and disarmament, and fundamentals of national security

title: Tamil Nadu sees 5.25 lakh dog bite cases, 28 rabies deaths so far in 2025
content: In view of the rise in cases of dog bites — from 4.8 lakh last year — the Director of Public Health and Preventive Medicine says the issue has to be tackled with inter-departmental coordination

title: T.N. Council of Historical Research invites applications for fellowship
content: The fellowship entails conducting in-depth and exhaustive research on the history of Tamil Nadu extracted from archival records in the State

title: In ‘unusual intervention’, SC forbids grant of bail to accused in digital arrest case
content: Justice Surya Kant said such cases of deception of senior citizens deserve “unusual orders”. “We have to deal with these cases sternly so that the right message is sent,” he said

title: ‘Indian Muslims no longer fear SIR, did not fall in Mamata’s trap’: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari
content: Trinamool Congress spokesperson retorts saying that the people of West Bengal are severely disgruntled with SIR; AI likely to be used to scan duplicacies in electoral roll, sources in CEO’s office say

title: India, Russia looking at finalising new pacts, initiatives during Putin's visit to New Delhi
content: As part of the preparations for the visit, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday, November 17, held extensive talks in Moscow with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov.

title: Poll petition: M. Swaraj withdraws appeal before SC
content: Mr. Swaraj had earlier approached the Kerala High Court, alleging that his rival candidate had canvassed votes on religious grounds

title: Delhi blast culprits will get strictest punishment: Amit Shah
content: Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, eliminating terrorism from its roots is our collective commitment, says Shah at Northern Zonal Council meet

title: Back-to-back weather systems to bring heavy rain to Tamil Nadu this week
content: The prevailing low pressure area over southwest Bay of Bengal and adjoining Sri Lanka will initially trigger heavy rainfall along the coastal districts and shift activity to south Tamil Nadu by Tuesday (November 18, 2025)

title: Modern classics: 25 of the best kits from the 21st century
content: the 1990s still reign supreme as the decade with the most enduring and sought-after retro football shirts . since the year 2000 we have seen some timeless entries into the jersey hall of fame . as we approach the end of 2025, we've assembled 25 of the best original kits released by top clubs from leagues all over the world .

title: What do Week 11 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: the Cowboys beat the Jets 3-0 in the aFC East on friday . the 49ers also won a high-scoring game over the Buccaneers . a record 47 completions from quarterback Jacoby Brissett led the Rams .

title: Antonio Brown's journey from All-Pro to criminal defendant
content: former all-pro wide receiver faces up to 30 years in prison . he pleaded not guilty last week and is scheduled for arraignment Monday . the 37-year-old's attorney and the prosecutor raised doubts about the alleged victim's claim that a bullet fired by Bronx was fired .

title: What does Justin Fields' benching mean for the future of the Jets?
content: Aaron Glenn benched quarterback Aaron Rodgers' replacement Justin Fields . the move signals the most likely end to the organization's $30 million gambit after 10 games . it will likely be a high draft pick (in 2026 or 2027) or perhaps a trade for a veteran .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through start of spring training .

title: Will your team make the playoffs? Simulate the rest of the regular season
content: Loading Playoff Seeds 1st Seed Denver Proj:   9-2 7th Seed Jacksonville Proj:   6-4 2nd Seed New England Proj:   9-2 6th Seed Los Angeles Proj:   7-4 3rd Seed Indianapolis Proj:   8-2 5th Seed Buffalo Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Pittsburgh Proj:   6-4 1st Seed Philadelphia Proj:   8-2 7th Seed San Francisco Proj:   7-4 2nd Seed Los Angeles Proj:   8-2 6th Seed Green Bay Proj:   6-3-1 3rd Seed Chicago Proj:   7-3 5th Seed Seattle Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Tampa Bay Proj:   6-4 See what the latest playoff picture looks like and simulate your own playoff scenarios! title: Free agent pickups: Believe in Brissett to replace your injured QB?
content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: 30 teams, seven tiers, one clear title favorite: How the league stacks up

title: 🏈 CFB Power Rankings: Oklahoma into top 10
content: Texas still has a path to the College Football Playoff despite three losses . the Aggies left Kyle Field at 10-0 for the first time since 1992 . they have areas to improve as the most important games, including their first appearance since 1992, are ahead .
